botanical_details.genus: Prunus can be deciduous or evergreen trees or shrubs with showy flowers in spring, and often good autumn foliage colour. Some have edible fruit in autumn, and a few species have ornamental bark

how_to_grow.cultivation: Tolerant of a range of well-drained soils but prefers clay loam in a sunny, sheltered site. Suitable for all training forms. Keep a weed-free area of at least 60cm radius around trunk. Thin fruits if necessary. Irrigate in dry periods. Flowers early, so at risk from spring frosts
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by chip budding or grafting onto a clonal rootstock for fruit. The rootstock largely determine the vigour of the tree
how_to_grow.pruning: Regular pruning required according to tree form - pruning plums, pruning established fans
how_to_grow.pests: Can get aphids, caterpillars, fruit tree red spider mite, brown scale, plum moth and bullfinches
how_to_grow.diseases: Susceptible to silver leaf, bacterial canker, blossom wilt and fruit to brown rot
